intro: Corispermum hyssopifolium var. gracile, commonly known as slender corispermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is a low-growing, herbaceous annual that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. It is adapted to arid and saline environments, making it a common species in dry, coastal or inland regions.
